Based on periodic properties, identify a molecule, <math alttext="X 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, that is likely to to react with <math alttext="S r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Sr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in a way similar to how <math alttext="C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> reacts with <math alttext="S r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Sr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your choice.

(c) A graph of potential energy versus internuclear distance for two <math alttext="C l"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms is given below. On the same graph, carefully sketch a curve that corresponds to potential energy versus internuclear distance for two <math alttext="B r"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms.

(d) In the box below, draw a complete Lewis electron-dot diagram for the <math alttext="C 2 C l 4"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> molecule.

(ii) What is the approximate chlorine-carbon-chlorine bond angle in <math alttext="C 2 C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>Â ?
